valr
  • Articles

  • News

Create intron features.

Numbers in the score column are intron numbers from 5' to 3' independent of strand. I.e., the first introns for + and - strand genes both have score values of 1.

create_introns(x)

Arguments

x

tbl_interval in BED12 format

Examples

x <- read_bed12(valr_example('mm9.refGene.bed.gz'))

create_introns(x)
#> # A tibble: 1,583 x 6
#>    chrom   start     end         name score strand
#>    <chr>   <int>   <int>        <chr> <dbl>  <chr>
#>  1  chr1 3207049 3411782 NM_001011874     2      -
#>  2  chr1 3411982 3660632 NM_001011874     1      -
#>  3  chr1 4283093 4341990 NM_001195662     3      -
#>  4  chr1 4342162 4342282 NM_001195662     2      -
#>  5  chr1 4342918 4399250 NM_001195662     1      -
#>  6  chr1 4848057 4857550 NM_001159750     1      +
#>  7  chr1 4848057 4857550    NM_011541     1      +
#>  8  chr1 4848584 4857550 NM_001159751     1      +
#>  9  chr1 4857613 4868107 NM_001159750     1      +
#> 10  chr1 4857613 4868107    NM_011541     1      +
#> # ... with 1,573 more rows
